imdb.plot outline: Sixty years ago, CONRAD WILEY founded Wiley and Co., which is now the biggest tobacco company in the US (Think: Philip Morris). Conrad had two sons: RANDOLPH and WENDELL. When Conrad passed away, he bequeathed most of his assets to Randolph, who had more brains, more guts, and more ruthlessness to run a company. Wendell received a million or so - which he subsequently squandered by funding a series of failed adult-themed remakes of classic TV programs. Today, Randolph is taking a leave of absence from the company to run as the Republican candidate for Mayor. Thinks the Tea Party is too liberal. Hasn't had sex with his wife in ten years... but is far from celibate. Wendell covets the success of his brother, Randolph, and never lets up on his dream of making legitimate, mainstream movies. Trapped in a frigid marriage, Wendell cannot help the love he feels for his sister-in-law, Janice. Randolph's son, KYLE, is the show's moral center - the only one who believes in the goodness of humanity. Wants to find his soul mate. Forced to work in the family business, but only agrees if they branch out into marijuana cigarettes. Kyle's life is turned upside down when he falls in love with a woman he meets - then loses - in an elevator. He goes back to the same spot every day, hoping she'll re-appear. Kyle's sister, LILLY, is a professional martyr, passionately "anti-tobacco," and a habitual chain smoker. Her goal is to derail her father's company and bid for Mayor. That said, she really wants to be a movie star. Kyle's mother, JANICE, is having a torrid affair with her nephew, LOGAN. She's a classic Park Avenue socialite and occasional model for AARP: The Magazine. Married Randolph for his money and admits it. Lusts after younger men. Doesn't know brother-in-law Wendell exists, even though he's in love with her. At any given moment, she may be pregnant and / or suicidal. Wendell's son, Logan, is Kyle's first cousin. Logan is firmly entrenched in the "bottom 99%" and wears his modest upbringing on his sleeve. Having an affair with his Aunt Janice. Moderately successful, part-time gigolo with no health insurance. Only wants to be rich. Will do anything to get there. Manipulative. Street smart. Wannabe. Wendell's wife and Kyle's stepmother, MARIE, is a former Miss Florida who solicits door-to-door for PEEA: People For the Ethical Euthanization of Animals - a dubious cartel of clothing manufacturers. Not surprisingly, she feels dead inside. Her goal: revenge on someone who wronged her many years ago. In a passionless marriage with Wendell, Marie accidentally re-connects with ANDY, her former high school sweetheart, with the hope of finding love again. UNFILTERED is the continuing story of two brothers, their respective families, and the contemptible ways in which they desperately try to get what they want out of life.
imdb.title: Unfiltered
plot: A dramedy about a dysfunctional family that owns the nation's largest tobacco company.

Sixty years ago, CONRAD WILEY founded Wiley and Co., which is now the biggest tobacco company in the US (Think: Philip Morris). Conrad had two sons: RANDOLPH and WENDELL. When Conrad passed away, he bequeathed most of his assets to Randolph, who had more brains, more guts, and more ruthlessness to run a company. Wendell received a million or so - which he subsequently squandered by funding a series of failed adult-themed remakes of classic TV programs. Today, Randolph is taking a leave of absence from the company to run as the Republican candidate for Mayor. Thinks the Tea Party is too liberal. Hasn't had sex with his wife in ten years... but is far from celibate. Wendell covets the success of his brother, Randolph, and never lets up on his dream of making legitimate, mainstream movies. Trapped in a frigid marriage, Wendell cannot help the love he feels for his sister-in-law, Janice. Randolph's son, KYLE, is the show's moral center - the only one who believes in the goodness of humanity. Wants to find his soul mate. Forced to work in the family business, but only agrees if they branch out into marijuana cigarettes. Kyle's life is turned upside down when he falls in love with a woman he meets - then loses - in an elevator. He goes back to the same spot every day, hoping she'll re-appear. Kyle's sister, LILLY, is a professional martyr, passionately "anti-tobacco," and a habitual chain smoker. Her goal is to derail her father's company and bid for Mayor. That said, she really wants to be a movie star. Kyle's mother, JANICE, is having a torrid affair with her nephew, LOGAN. She's a classic Park Avenue socialite and occasional model for AARP: The Magazine. Married Randolph for his money and admits it. Lusts after younger men. Doesn't know brother-in-law Wendell exists, even though he's in love with her. At any given moment, she may be pregnant and / or suicidal. Wendell's son, Logan, is Kyle's first cousin. Logan is firmly entrenched in the "bottom 99%" and wears his modest upbringing on his sleeve. Having an affair with his Aunt Janice. Moderately successful, part-time gigolo with no health insurance. Only wants to be rich. Will do anything to get there. Manipulative. Street smart. Wannabe. Wendell's wife and Kyle's stepmother, MARIE, is a former Miss Florida who solicits door-to-door for PEEA: People For the Ethical Euthanization of Animals - a dubious cartel of clothing manufacturers. Not surprisingly, she feels dead inside. Her goal: revenge on someone who wronged her many years ago. In a passionless marriage with Wendell, Marie accidentally re-connects with ANDY, her former high school sweetheart, with the hope of finding love again. UNFILTERED is the continuing story of two brothers, their respective families, and the contemptible ways in which they desperately try to get what they want out of life.
